intro: Sarcotheca macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved sarcotesta, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
